                                                 WidgetInfo widgetInfo,
                                                 String xApiUser,
                                                 String xOnBehalfOfUser,
                                                 ProgressResponseBody.ProgressListener progressListener,
                                                 ProgressRequestBody.ProgressRequestListener progressRequestListener)
                                          throws ApiException
        Build call for createWidget
        Parameters:
        authorization - An <a href=\"#\" onclick=\"this.href=oauthDoc()\" oncontextmenu=\"this.href=oauthDoc()\" target=\"oauthDoc\">OAuth Access Token</a> with scopes:<ul><li style='list-style-type: square'><a href=\"#\" onclick=\"this.href=oauthDoc('widget_write')\" oncontextmenu=\"this.href=oauthDoc('widget_write')\" target=\"oauthDoc\">widget_write</a></li></ul>in the format <b>'Bearer {accessToken}'. (required)
        widgetInfo - Information about the widget that you want to create. (required)
        xApiUser - The userId or email of API caller using the account or group token in the format <b>userid:{userId} OR email:{email}.</b> If it is not specified, then the caller is inferred from the token. (optional)
        xOnBehalfOfUser - The userId or email in the format <b>userid:{userId} OR email:{email}.</b> of the user that has shared his/her account (optional)
        progressListener - Progress listener
        progressRequestListener - Progress request listener
        Returns:
        Call to execute
        Throws:
        ApiException - If fail to serialize the request body object

      • createWidget

        public WidgetCreationResponse createWidget(String authorization,
                                           WidgetInfo widgetInfo,
                                           String xApiUser,
                                           String xOnBehalfOfUser)
                                    throws ApiException
        Creates a widget and and returns the widgetId in the response to the client. This is a primary endpoint which is used to create a new widget. You can create a widget in one of the 3 mentioned states: a) <b>DRAFT</b> - to incrementally build the widget, b) <b>AUTHORING</b> - to add/edit form fields in the widget, c) <b>ACTIVE</b> - to immediately host the widget. You can use the PUT /widgets/{widgetId}/state endpoint to transition a widget between the above mentioned states. An allowed transition would follow the any of the following sequences: DRAFT->AUTHORING->ACTIVE, ACTIVE<->INACTIVE, DRAFT->CANCELLED.
        Parameters:
        authorization - An <a href=\"#\" onclick=\"this.href=oauthDoc()\" oncontextmenu=\"this.href=oauthDoc()\" target=\"oauthDoc\">OAuth Access Token</a> with scopes:<ul><li style='list-style-type: square'><a href=\"#\" onclick=\"this.href=oauthDoc('widget_write')\" oncontextmenu=\"this.href=oauthDoc('widget_write')\" target=\"oauthDoc\">widget_write</a></li></ul>in the format <b>'Bearer {accessToken}'. (required)
        widgetInfo - Information about the widget that you want to create. (required)
        xApiUser - The userId or email of API caller using the account or group token in the format <b>userid:{userId} OR email:{email}.</b> If it is not specified, then the caller is inferred from the token. (optional)
        xOnBehalfOfUser - The userId or email in the format <b>userid:{userId} OR email:{email}.</b> of the user that has shared his/her account (optional)
        Returns:
        WidgetCreationResponse
        Throws:
        ApiException - If fail to call the API, e.g. server error or cannot deserialize the response body

        public ApiResponse<WidgetCreationResponse> createWidgetWithHttpInfo(String authorization,
                                                                    WidgetInfo widgetInfo,
                                                                    String xApiUser,
                                                                    String xOnBehalfOfUser)
                                                             throws ApiException
        Creates a widget and and returns the widgetId in the response to the client. This is a primary endpoint which is used to create a new widget. You can create a widget in one of the 3 mentioned states: a) <b>DRAFT</b> - to incrementally build the widget, b) <b>AUTHORING</b> - to add/edit form fields in the widget, c) <b>ACTIVE</b> - to immediately host the widget. You can use the PUT /widgets/{widgetId}/state endpoint to transition a widget between the above mentioned states. An allowed transition would follow the any of the following sequences: DRAFT->AUTHORING->ACTIVE, ACTIVE<->INACTIVE, DRAFT->CANCELLED.
        Parameters:
        authorization - An <a href=\"#\" onclick=\"this.href=oauthDoc()\" oncontextmenu=\"this.href=oauthDoc()\" target=\"oauthDoc\">OAuth Access Token</a> with scopes:<ul><li style='list-style-type: square'><a href=\"#\" onclick=\"this.href=oauthDoc('widget_write')\" oncontextmenu=\"this.href=oauthDoc('widget_write')\" target=\"oauthDoc\">widget_write</a></li></ul>in the format <b>'Bearer {accessToken}'. (required)
        widgetInfo - Information about the widget that you want to create. (required)
        xApiUser - The userId or email of API caller using the account or group token in the format <b>userid:{userId} OR email:{email}.</b> If it is not specified, then the caller is inferred from the token. (optional)
        xOnBehalfOfUser - The userId or email in the format <b>userid:{userId} OR email:{email}.</b> of the user that has shared his/her account (optional)
        Returns:
        ApiResponse<WidgetCreationResponse>
        Throws:
        ApiException - If fail to call the API, e.g. server error or cannot deserialize the response body

      • createWidgetAsync

        public com.squareup.okhttp.Call createWidgetAsync(String authorization,
                                                  WidgetInfo widgetInfo,
                                                  String xApiUser,
                                                  String xOnBehalfOfUser,
                                                  ApiCallback<WidgetCreationResponse> callback)
                                           throws ApiException
        Creates a widget and and returns the widgetId in the response to the client. (asynchronously) This is a primary endpoint which is used to create a new widget. You can create a widget in one of the 3 mentioned states: a) <b>DRAFT</b> - to incrementally build the widget, b) <b>AUTHORING</b> - to add/edit form fields in the widget, c) <b>ACTIVE</b> - to immediately host the widget. You can use the PUT /widgets/{widgetId}/state endpoint to transition a widget between the above mentioned states. An allowed transition would follow the any of the following sequences: DRAFT->AUTHORING->ACTIVE, ACTIVE<->INACTIVE, DRAFT->CANCELLED.
        Parameters:
        authorization - An <a href=\"#\" onclick=\"this.href=oauthDoc()\" oncontextmenu=\"this.href=oauthDoc()\" target=\"oauthDoc\">OAuth Access Token</a> with scopes:<ul><li style='list-style-type: square'><a href=\"#\" onclick=\"this.href=oauthDoc('widget_write')\" oncontextmenu=\"this.href=oauthDoc('widget_write')\" target=\"oauthDoc\">widget_write</a></li></ul>in the format <b>'Bearer {accessToken}'. (required)
        widgetInfo - Information about the widget that you want to create. (required)
        xApiUser - The userId or email of API caller using the account or group token in the format <b>userid:{userId} OR email:{email}.</b> If it is not specified, then the caller is inferred from the token. (optional)
        xOnBehalfOfUser - The userId or email in the format <b>userid:{userId} OR email:{email}.</b> of the user that has shared his/her account (optional)
        callback - The callback to be executed when the API call finishes
        Returns:
        The request call
        Throws:
        ApiException - If fail to process the API call, e.g. serializing the request body object

      • getAllWidgetMembersCall

        public com.squareup.okhttp.Call getAllWidgetMembersCall(String authorization,
                                                        String widgetId,
                                                        String xApiUser,
                                                        String xOnBehalfOfUser,
                                                        String ifNoneMatch,
                                                        ProgressResponseBody.ProgressListener progressListener,
                                                        ProgressRequestBody.ProgressRequestListener progressRequestListener)
                                                 throws ApiException
        Build call for getAllWidgetMembers
        Parameters:
        authorization - An <a href=\"#\" onclick=\"this.href=oauthDoc()\" oncontextmenu=\"this.href=oauthDoc()\" target=\"oauthDoc\">OAuth Access Token</a> with scopes:<ul><li style='list-style-type: square'><a href=\"#\" onclick=\"this.href=oauthDoc('widget_read')\" oncontextmenu=\"this.href=oauthDoc('widget_read')\" target=\"oauthDoc\">widget_read</a></li></ul>in the format <b>'Bearer {accessToken}'. (required)
        widgetId - The widget identifier, as returned by the widget creation API or retrieved from the API to fetch widgets. (required)
        xApiUser - The userId or email of API caller using the account or group token in the format <b>userid:{userId} OR email:{email}.</b> If it is not specified, then the caller is inferred from the token. (optional)
        xOnBehalfOfUser - The userId or email in the format <b>userid:{userId} OR email:{email}.</b> of the user that has shared his/her account (optional)
        ifNoneMatch - Pass the value of the e-tag header obtained from the previous response to the same request to get a RESOURCE_NOT_MODIFIED(304) if the resource hasn't changed. (optional)
        progressListener - Progress listener
        progressRequestListener - Progress request listener
        Returns:
        Call to execute
        Throws:
        ApiException - If fail to serialize the request body object

      • updateWidgetState

        public void updateWidgetState(String authorization,
                              String ifMatch,
                              String widgetId,
                              WidgetStateInfo widgetStateInfo,
                              String xApiUser,
                              String xOnBehalfOfUser)
                       throws ApiException
        Updates the state of a widget identified by widgetId in the path. This endpoint can be used by creator of the widget to transition between the states of widget. An allowed transition would follow any of the following sequence : DRAFT->AUTHORING->ACTIVE, ACTIVE<->INACTIVE, DRAFT->CANCELLED.
        Parameters:
        authorization - An <a href=\"#\" onclick=\"this.href=oauthDoc()\" oncontextmenu=\"this.href=oauthDoc()\" target=\"oauthDoc\">OAuth Access Token</a> with scopes:<ul><li style='list-style-type: square'><a href=\"#\" onclick=\"this.href=oauthDoc('widget_write')\" oncontextmenu=\"this.href=oauthDoc('widget_write')\" target=\"oauthDoc\">widget_write</a></li></ul>in the format <b>'Bearer {accessToken}'. (required)
        ifMatch - The server will only update the resource if it matches the listed ETag otherwise error RESOURCE_MODIFIED(412) is returned. (required)
        widgetId - The widget identifier, as returned by the widget creation API or retrieved from the API to fetch widgets. (required)
        widgetStateInfo - (required)
        xApiUser - The userId or email of API caller using the account or group token in the format <b>userid:{userId} OR email:{email}.</b> If it is not specified, then the caller is inferred from the token. (optional)
        xOnBehalfOfUser - The userId or email in the format <b>userid:{userId} OR email:{email}.</b> of the user that has shared his/her account (optional)
        Throws:
        ApiException - If fail to call the API, e.g. server error or cannot deserialize the response body
